column4: ah Dr_willis : thnx .. :) ... I just want to know one more thing .. how can I know which packages belong to that debian repo ??
If you're having trouble with flash, try downloading the deb package from adobe.com and installing that. (of course, uninstall any flash packages that you get from the repos before doing this)
: my problem is way far from just installing another Flash package .. I have tried everything nothing seems to fix that broken package
If you've mixed Debian packages with Ubuntu, it's best that you reinstall.
: no other solution :( ? I'll have to get an external HD and like BACK UP everything lol !
It's a complicated system - there are lots of dependencies between packages, etc. Not worth the hassle if you're not technically skilled enough.
: oh well ... thanks :) I'll get that External now I guess
Only the Core Duo/Core 2 Duo line is 64 bit I believe.
: is there a command I can add to the terminal to know ?
: thnx :) .. thats funny the attached stamp on the laptop is intel centrino duo but in the terminal Inter core .. 64bit
I don't see any reason why you can't.
That's all right - is this going to be your first time trying out Ubuntu?
: no I started using it with Feisty Release .. :$
